message.content: This question requires knowledge about thermal conductivity, which refers to the ability of a material to conduct heat. Option (A) is correct because leaving a fire log poker in the fireplace allows it to absorb heat and become hot due to the thermal conductivity of the metal. Option (B) is incorrect because sitting down on a bed does not involve the transfer of heat. Option (C) is unrelated to thermal conductivity. Option (D) is unrelated to thermal conductivity and refers to sound amplification.

This question requires knowledge about thermal conductivity and how it relates to objects conducting heat. Thermal conductivity refers to the ability of a material to conduct heat. Option (A) is correct because leaving a fire log poker in the fireplace allows it to conduct heat and become hot, demonstrating thermal conductivity. Option (B) is incorrect because sitting down on a bed does not involve heat conduction. Option (C) and (D) are unrelated to thermal conductivity as they involve kinetic motion and sound amplification, respectively.

This question requires basic knowledge about thermal conductivity. Thermal conductivity refers to the ability of a material to conduct heat. In option (A), leaving a fire log poker in the fireplace, the metal poker conducts heat from the fire to the handle, making the handle hot to the touch. Option (B) is incorrect because sitting down on a bed does not involve the transfer of heat. Option (C) is unrelated to heat transfer. Option (D) is unrelated to heat transfer and involves sound amplification rather than thermal conductivity.

This question tests knowledge about thermal conductivity, which is the ability of a material to conduct or transfer heat. Option (A) is the correct answer because leaving a fire log poker in the fireplace allows the metal to absorb heat from the fire and conduct it to the other end of the poker, making it hot to the touch. Option (B) is incorrect because sitting down on a bed does not involve the transfer of heat. Option (C) is incorrect because throwing a large ball does not involve heat transfer. Option (D) is incorrect because yelling into a megaphone has nothing to do with thermal conductivity.
